oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Riverside Baptist Church, 2001 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Riverside Baptist Church located at 1604 Riverside Drive in Nashville, Tennessee in the East Nashville neighborhood. This church was built in 1951. The foundation is brick. The exterior walls are brick. The roof is gabled and made of tar shingles. The windows are stained glass, tall and arched. The doors are wood with some glass windows. Special features include an octagon steeple with an oculus and four Corinthian columns at the entrance supporting a portico. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Riverside Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
